blocks.text: Indicators of compromise are observable artifacts that suggest malicious activity has occurred or is ongoing. These include IP addresses, file hashes, domain names, registry entries, and behavioral patterns.

IOCs enable automated detection and threat hunting by allowing systems to quickly flag known malicious signatures. They are commonly shared through threat intelligence feeds and incident response communities.
However, reliance on static IOCs has limitations. Attackers frequently change infrastructure and malware signatures to evade detection, rendering older indicators obsolete.
Effective detection combines IOCs with behavioral analysis and anomaly detection, providing broader visibility into evolving threats.
